title: Robustness and Stability
description: All changes must improve the robustness, functionality, efficiency, and stability of the project.
rules: Changes must improve at least one quality attribute
Changes must maintain backward compatibility where possible
Changes must be reviewed for potential impacts on system stability
examples: Conducting impact assessments for stability risks
Performance benchmarking before and after changes
Implementing robust error handling and recovery
Ensuring backward compatibility with proper versioning
Measuring and documenting quality attribute improvements
Creating comprehensive maintenance guides and documentation
exceptions: Critical security patches that may require breaking changes
Major architectural changes with proper migration paths
